text: Penelope Vincenzi (, 10 April 1939 â€“ 25 February 2018) was a British novelist. She was born in Bournemouth, England. She wrote 17 novels and 2 collections of stories. Her sales by 2014 amounted to over 7 million copies. She started work for the Daily Mirror as a secretary, and after a year was working for Marjorie Proops, she knowing of her journalistic ambitions, let her help with research and small tasks. Vincenzi was also a fashion journalist, she worked for various publications, including the Daily Mirror and Vogue. Vincenzi died on 25 February 2018, aged 78.'Beloved' author Penny Vincenzi dies == References == Category:1939 births Category:2018 deaths Category:English novelists Category:Writers from Dorset Category:People from Bournemouth
title: Penny Vincenzi
